column5: Hi there, I want to move my gas tank to the front of the boat for better weight distribution.  The hose is about a foot too short.  Is there an easy way I can extend the fuel line?  Thanks in advance!
Yep, you can buy it by the foot at most marine shops.  S.

Last time I did one I took it apart at the primer bulb & tank fitting then inserted a new length of hose using simple gear clamps.  Hose & clamps were bought at my local Home hardware and it took me almost a whole 1/2 hour to do the job - meaning quick and easy.  I wrapped a bit of electrical tape around the clamps afterwards just to cover up the bit that sticks out after torquing them up and checking for no leaks.  Michael

did the same thing a few years back, I pulled into the marina with the owner laughing at me as I pulled in with the nose way up.  5 mins and $10.00 later he added a 6 foot extension and problem solved
Thank you!  Just did it and works great!
Just be careful as some of the newer outboards require a larger inside diameter hose then the older models called for.
Thanks.  I used the same diameter.
